reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes U.S. Fish and Wildlife (Service) staff will work cooperatively with the Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies (AFWA) to develop and implement a range of science development, implementation, and coordination activities as described in the statement of work submitted with the application. Specifically, the Service participates in the semi-annual science coordination meetings with other federal agencies and AFWA to prioritize the activities of AFWA Science Coordination Team, based on input from various Service program areas and other agencies in their ongoing activities and science needs, review performance on recent activities, and revise tactics and strategies as necessary to meet goals. Based on identified goals and strategies from these coordination meetings, Service staff from various program areas work with the AFWA science staff to implement these science strategies via various cooperative Federal/State/Private teams and committees including the FWS Climate Change Team, the North American Bird Conservation Initiative, National Fish Habitat Action Plan, the AFWA Science and Research Committee, Partners in Amphibian and Reptile Conservation, the Endangered Species Task Force, and the National Invasive Species Council..
